title: Scalable Membership Inference Attacks via Quantile Regression. (arXiv:2307.03694v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Membership inference attacks are designed to determine, using black box access to trained models, whether a particular example was used in training or not. Membership inference can be formalized as a hypothesis testing problem. The most effective existing attacks estimate the distribution of some test statistic (usually the model's confidence on the true label) on points that were (and were not) used in training by training many \emph{shadow models} -i.e. models of the same architecture as the model being attacked, trained on a random subsample of data. While effective, these attacks are extremely computationally expensive, especially when the model under attack is large.  We introduce a new class of attacks based on performing quantile regression on the distribution of confidence scores induced by the model under attack on points that are not used in training. We show that our method is competitive with state-of-the-art shadow model attacks, while requiring substantially less comput

Title: Scalable Membership Inference Attacks via Quantile Regression. (arXiv:2307.03694v1 [cs.LG])
Abstract: Membership inference attacks are designed to determine, using black box access to trained models, whether a particular example was used in training or not. Membership inference can be formalized as a hypothesis testing problem. The most effective existing attacks estimate the distribution of some test statistic (usually the model's confidence on the true label) on points that were (and were not) used in training by training many \emph{shadow models} -i.e. models of the same architecture as the model being attacked, trained on a random subsample of data. While effective, these attacks are extremely computationally expensive, especially when the model under attack is large.  We introduce a new class of attacks based on performing quantile regression on the distribution of confidence scores induced by the model under attack on points that are not used in training. We show that our method is competitive with state-of-the-art shadow model attacks, while requiring substantially less comput
translated_title: 可伸缩的通过分位数回归进行成员推断攻击
translated_abstract: 成员推断攻击旨在通过对训练模型进行黑盒访问，确定特定示例是否在训练中使用。成员推断可以形式化为一个假设检验问题。现有最有效的攻击是通过训练许多与被攻击模型相同架构的“影子模型”（在随机数据子样本上训练）来估计某些测试统计量（通常是模型对真实标签的置信度）的分布。虽然有效，但这些攻击非常计算密集，特别是当被攻击的模型很大时。我们引入了一种新的攻击方式，通过对未在训练中使用的点上的被攻击模型产生的置信度分布进行分位数回归。我们证明了我们的方法与最先进的影子模型攻击相竞争，同时需要更少的计算量。
tldr: 通过分位数回归进行成员推断攻击的方法，与现有的影子模型攻击相比，计算量更小但效果相当。
en_tdlr: A new method for membership inference attacks based on quantile regression is introduced. It is competitive with existing shadow model attacks while requiring less computational resources.
